Class BCS

java.lang.Object
BCS
public class BCS
extends java.lang.Object
BCS.java The main program of our Ballot Counting System (BCS). Created by Jason Phadnis, Kobin Khadka, Brandon Schenck, and Gavin Huang

  • Constructor Details

    • BCS

      public BCS()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.io.IOException
      The entry point of our application. It will ask the user to input the name of a file within the same directory as this program. It will indicate and error and ask the user for the filename again if an invalid name is given. This input file is to have information about the election to be run, including the type, the candidates, and the ballots themselves. The main also sets up the input file reader and the audit file writer with the creatAuditFile() function. It then chooses whether to run the IR or the OPL algorithm based on the input file.
      Parameters:
      args - the input arguments
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - the io exception

    • ir

      public static void ir() throws java.io.IOException
      Runs the IR voting algorithm. This makes use of a few helper functions found below.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - the io exception. This function throws this exception when there is an error with generating the audit file.

    • parseBallotsForIR

      public static void parseBallotsForIR​(java.util.ArrayList<IRBallot> irBallotList, char[] candidateParties, java.lang.String[] candidateNamesOnly, int id) throws java.io.IOException
      This function will parse the information from IR election ballots given to the system and avoid counting invalid ballots.
      Parameters:
      irBallotList - - Ballot List from IR election
      candidateParties - - Parties of candidates participate in election
      candidateNamesOnly - - Names of the candidates participate in election
      id - - uniquely identifies each ballot
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - - throws exeception if ballot reader fails to look for next file.

    • getIRCandidateParties

      public static char[] getIRCandidateParties​(java.lang.String[] candidateWithParty)
      This function returns a character array that contains the parties of each candidate.
      Parameters:
      candidateWithParty - is a string array that contains the candidates along with the party.
      Returns:
      a character array listing the candidate parties.

    • generateIRReport

      public static void generateIRReport​(int numCandidates, int numBallots, Candidate winner, java.util.ArrayList<Candidate> availableCandidates, java.util.ArrayList<Candidate> eliminatedCandidates)
      Generates the press release file and prints the results of the election to the screen.
      Parameters:
      numCandidates - is the number of candidates in the election
      numBallots - the number of ballots in the election
      winner - the winner of the election
      availableCandidates - the available candidates that are still in the running.
      eliminatedCandidates - the eliminated candidates that are out of the running.

    • printResults

      public static void printResults​(java.util.ArrayList<Candidate> availableCandidates, java.util.ArrayList<Candidate> eliminatedCandidates, Candidate winner) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the results of the election to the audit file
      Parameters:
      availableCandidates - the available candidates that are still in the running.
      eliminatedCandidates - the eliminated candidates that are out of the running.
      winner - the winner of the election
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - the io exception. This function throws this exception when there is an error with generating the audit file.

    • distributeIRVotes

      public static void distributeIRVotes​(java.util.ArrayList<IRBallot> irBallotList, java.util.ArrayList<Candidate> availableCandidates)
      This function distributes votes to the candidates still in the running. It is also responsible for redistributing an eliminated candidate's votes.
      Parameters:
      irBallotList - the list of ballots to be distributed.
      availableCandidates - the available candidates that are still in the running.

    • po

      public static void po()
      Run the PO algorithm that handles PO election informations.

    • opl

      public static void opl()
      Run the OPL algorithm. This makes use of a few helper functions which can be found below this function.

    • createParties

      public static void createParties​(java.lang.String[] candidateInfo, java.util.ArrayList<Party> parties)
      Create parties for use in OPL. Create the Party objects, create the Candidate objects, and add Candidates to the correct Party.
      Parameters:
      candidateInfo - the candidate info where each element is in the form of "[candidate name],[party]"
      parties - the parties ArrayList that will store the result of this function

    • createAndDistributeOPLBallots

      public static void createAndDistributeOPLBallots​(int startIndex, java.util.ArrayList<OPLBallot> ballots, java.lang.String[] candidateInfo, java.util.ArrayList<Party> parties)
      Create and distribute opl ballots to the appropriate candidates. This also updates the parties' vote counts accordingly.
      Parameters:
      ballots - the array list to store the ballots. Its length is the sum of the number of ballots as given by the input file(s).
      candidateInfo - the candidate info where each element is in the form of "[candidate name],[party]"
      parties - the parties ArrayList

    • parseBallotsForPO

      public static void parseBallotsForPO​(java.util.ArrayList<POBallot> ballots, java.lang.String[] candidateInfo)
      This function parse ballot file and create PO ballots
      Parameters:
      ballots - file from the PO election
      candidateInfo - is the information about the candidates participated in the election

    • parseBallotsForOPL

      public static void parseBallotsForOPL​(java.util.ArrayList<OPLBallot> ballots, java.lang.String[] candidateInfo, java.util.ArrayList<Party> parties)
      This function will parse election information from OPL ballot file
      Parameters:
      ballots - - Lists of ballots from the election
      candidateInfo - - Information about the candidates who participated in the OPL election
      parties - - Parties that participated in the election

    • distributeSeatsToParties

      public static void distributeSeatsToParties​(int numBallots, int numSeats, java.util.ArrayList<Party> parties)
      Distribute seats to parties.
      Parameters:
      numBallots - the number of ballots
      numSeats - the number of seats available in this election
      parties - the parties ArrayList

    • getDateTime

      public static java.lang.String getDateTime()
      Gets the current date and time to use in system generated file names.
      Returns:
      a string of the form "[current Date]_[current time]"

    • createAuditFile

      public static void createAuditFile()
      Create the audit file and have the writer ready to use in other functions.

    • coinFlip

      public static int coinFlip()
      Simulate a fair coin toss to evaluate ties.
      Returns:
      the int 0 or 1.

    • setElectionTypeForTest

      public static void setElectionTypeForTest​(int type)
      Set the election type for the purpose of testing. Only use in test cases that need to explicitly set the election type.

    • closeFileWriterForTest

      public static void closeFileWriterForTest​(java.lang.String errorMsg)
      Close an opened audit file writer for the purpose of testing. Only use in test cases that need naturally open and use the auditFileWriter which then needs to be closed.
      Parameters:
      errorMsg - a String of the error message that should be printed by the catch block.

    • openReaderForTest

      public static void openReaderForTest()
      Open a file reader for the purpose of testing. Only use in test cases that need to explicitly read in a test ballot file.

    • closeReaderForTest

      public static void closeReaderForTest()
      Closes a file reader for the purpose of testing. Only use in test cases that need to explicitly close ballotReader.

    • setFilesForParsingTest

      public static void setFilesForParsingTest​(java.lang.String fileName)
      This function handles ballot file and add the new files in the ballot file list
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the file that will be given to the system
